text: Walter "Wally" Gould (25 September 1938 – 10 March 2018) was an English professional footballer. Gould made nearly 300 appearances and scored 71 goals in the Football League playing as a winger or forward for Sheffield United, York City and Brighton & Hove Albion. He later played for Durban United and Hellenic in South Africa. Gould died of vascular dementia on 10 March 2018 at the age of 79. ==Career statistics== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League FA Cup League Cup Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Sheffield United 1958–59 Second Division 5 1 0 0 — 5 1 York City 1960–61 Fourth Division 13 3 0 0 0 0 13 3 1961–62 Fourth Division 41 6 1 0 7 0 48 6 1962–63 Fourth Division 42 11 3 0 2 1 47 12 1963–64 Fourth Division 25 6 1 0 4 0 30 6 Total 120 25 5 0 13 1 138 26 Brighton & Hove Albion 1963–64 Fourth Division 18 3 0 0 0 0 18 3 Brighton & Hove Albion 1964–65 Fourth Division 43 21 1 0 2 0 46 21 Brighton & Hove Albion 1965–66 Fourth Division 41 10 3 1 3 0 47 11 Brighton & Hove Albion 1966–67 Fourth Division 42 9 6 0 6 0 54 9 Brighton & Hove Albion 1967–68 Fourth Division 24 2 2 0 2 0 28 2 Brighton & Hove Albion Total 168 45 12 1 13 0 193 46 Career total 293 71 17 1 26 1 336 73 ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. players Category:Deaths from vascular dementia Category:English footballers Category:Sheffield United F.C. players Category:Association football coaches
